intro: Cleistanthus pallidus, commonly known as the pale cleistanthus, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological characteristics. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and smooth, often hairy leaves. It typically grows in forested areas and is known for its ability to thrive in shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a relatively rare species.
